titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 27: Algorismus.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Pedagogical treatise on commercial and practical arithmetic, with extensive use of arabic numerals and problems illustrated with scenes from daily life.

msItem.title: Table of contents, f. v recto

supportDesc.extent: 113 leaves : 213 x 154 (144 x 95) mm. bound to 220 x 162 mm

collation.p: Parchment, 113; 1-2⁶ 3¹⁰ 4¹⁰(+1) 5-8¹⁰ 9¹⁰(-1) 10⁸ 11¹⁰(-1) 12¹⁰ 13⁴; [i-xii], 1-62, 63-79, 81-101, [102-103]; contemporary foliation in ink, upper center. Vertical catchwords on last verso of gatherings 3-13, lower right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 31 long lines, with the table of contents in 2 columns; bounding lines ruled in faint ink, with the first line of text frequently above the upper horizontal bounding line.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a semi-cursive script in the hand of Pietro Paolo Muscarello.

decoDesc.decoNote: Full illuminated border including the arms of the Alberti family and 8-line inhabited initial showing a bearded man in a turban reading from a book (f. 1r); 54 illustrations in color (f. 58r-101r); one section of geometric diagrams (f. 87r-90r); 4 manicules (f. 17v, 46r, 48v, 49r); 3 initials in gold (f. v recto, 11r, 86r); decorated initials throughout in red or blue flourished in purple or red, sometimes including small images (for example, a rabbit (f. 2r) and a goose (f. 21r)); capitals touched in yellow; edges sprinkled in blue.
Illuminated initial, Initial Q, f. v recto

Decorated initial, Initial D, f. vi verso

Miniature, Three men pointing out a hill town to a schoolboy, f. 58r
Miniature, Three boys surveying and measuring the hill town with scientific instruments and trigonometry, f. 58v
Miniature, Two tailors with fabric and scissors, f. 61v
Miniature, Old man holding bag of money and his two heirs, f. 65v [=64v]

Miniature, Prince giving fruit to suitor of his young daughter who is looking out of the window of her castle, f. 79v [=78v]
Miniature, Man tapping barrel and three jets of red wine running out, f. 81r [=79r]
Miniature, Two men on horseback approaching city, f. 81v [=79v]
Two men hunting with falcons and hounds, f. 82r [=80r]
Miniature, Two men on horseback approaching city, f. 82v [=80v]

Miniature, Two merchants distributing coins among themselves, f. 84r [=82r]

Two towers joined by a rope with a ring on it, f. 96v [=94v]

Miniature, Man with sextant scratching his head as he wonders how to calculate the heights of a tower from the sun, f. 98v [=96v]
Miniature, Two men looking at three stars in a row, f. 99r [=97r]
Miniature, Two birds on top of two towers, f. 99v [=97v]
Miniature, Tailor with three rolls of cloth, a measuring instrument, and a pair of scissors, f. 100r [=98r]

binding.p: 18th-century mottled calf; gilt spine; marbled pastedowns.

history.provenance: Illuminated for a member of the Albertini family of Nola (their arms, f. 1r); 17th-century inscription, Stefano Scarella di San Remo (f. 102v).
Sold at auction at Sotheby's, 23 June 1992, lot 73, to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.
